ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:0.3_0: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:0.5_0: 32. The training rule on group meals
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.2_0: Because of decline in material support and loss of respect, Devadatta and his followers were only invited to meals after repeatedly asking.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.3_0: People then complained and criticized those nuns,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.4_0: “How can the Sakyan ascetics eat at invitations after repeatedly asking?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.6_0: The monks heard those people complaining,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.7_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Devadatta,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.8_0: “How can Devadatta and his followers eat at invitations after repeatedly asking?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.9_0: “Is it true, Devadatta, that you do this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.12_0: “... Foolish man, how can you and your followers eat at invitations after repeatedly asking?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.13_0: Foolish man, this won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.14_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.15.1_0: ‘If a monk eats in a group, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.16_0: The Buddha has laid down a training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:2.1_0: Soon afterwards people invited sick monks to a meal.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:2.2_0: Yet again the monks thought, “The Buddha has prohibited eating at a group.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:2.3_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:2.4_0: who gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:2.5_0: “Monks, I allow a sick monk to eat in a group.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:2.6_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:2.7.1_0: ‘If a monk eats in a group, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:2.8_0: This is the appropriate occasion: it is the sick.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:2.9_0: The Buddha has laid down a training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.1_0: Soon afterwards, during the robe-giving season, people prepared a meal together with robe-cloth and then invited the monks, saying,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.2_0: “We wish to offer you a meal and then give you robe-cloth.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.3_0: Yet again the monks thought, “The Buddha has prohibited eating at a group.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.4_0: As a result, only a little robe-cloth was given at that monastery.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.5_0: They told the Buddha. He then had the Sangha gathered and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.6_0: “Monks, I allow you to eat in a group during the robe-giving season.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.7_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.8.1_0: ‘If a monk eats in a group, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.9_0: This is the appropriate occasion: he is sick.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.10_0: The Buddha has laid down a training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:4.1_0: Soon afterwards people invited monks who were making robes for a meal.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:4.2_0: Yet again the monks thought, “The Buddha has prohibited eating at a group.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:4.3_0: They told the Buddha. He then had the Sangha gathered and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:4.4_0: “Monks, I allow you to eat in a group at a time when you are making robes.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:4.5_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:4.6.1_0: ‘If a monk eats in a group, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:4.7_0: This is the appropriate occasion: he is sick; it is the robe-giving season.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:4.8_0: The Buddha has laid down a training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.1_0: Soon afterwards monks went traveling with some people.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.2_0: The monks said to the people,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.3_0: “Please wait a moment while we walk for alms.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.6_0: But being afraid of wrongdoing, the monks did not receive them from a group.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.7_0: They told the Buddha. He then had the Sangha gathered and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.8_0: “Monks, I allow you to eat in a group when you’re traveling.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.9_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.10.1_0: ‘If a monk eats in a group, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.11_1: he is sick; it is the robe-giving season; it is a time of making robes; he is traveling.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.12_0: The Buddha has laid down a training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.1_0: Soon afterwards monks boarded a boat with some people.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.2_0: The monks said to the people, “Please go to the shore for a moment while we walk for alms.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.3_0: They replied, “Venerables, please eat right here.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.4_0: But being afraid of wrongdoing, the monks did not receive them from a group.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.5_0: They told the Buddha. He then had the Sangha gathered and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.6_0: “Monks, I allow you to eat in a group when you’re traveling by boat.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.7_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.8.1_0: ‘If a monk eats in a group, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.9_1: These are the robe-giving season; it is a time of making robes; he is traveling; he is traveling by boat.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.10_0: The Buddha has laid down a training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:7.1_0: Soon afterwards monks who had completed the rainy-season residence in various regions were coming to Rājagaha to visit the Buddha.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:7.2_0: People saw those monks who had come from various countries, and they invited them for a meal.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:7.3_0: Yet again the monks thought, “The Buddha has prohibited eating at a group.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:7.4_0: They told the Buddha. He then had the Sangha gathered and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:7.5_0: “Monks, I allow you to eat in a group on big occasions.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:7.6_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:7.7.1_0: ‘If a monk eats in a group, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:7.8_1: These are the robe-giving season; it is a time of making robes; he is traveling; he is traveling by boat; it is a big occasion.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:7.9_0: The Buddha has laid down a training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.1_0: Soon afterwards a relative of King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha who had gone forth with the Ājīvaka ascetics had gone forth.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.1_1: That Ājīvaka ascetic then went to King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.1_2: They then approached King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha and said, “Great king, I wish to make meals for the meals.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.2_0: “That’s fine, Sir, if you first feed the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.4_0: And he sent a message to the monks: “Please accept a meal from me tomorrow.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.5_0: Yet again the monks thought, “The Buddha has prohibited eating at a group.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.6_0: That Ājīvaka ascetic then went to the Buddha,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.6_1: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he stood to one side, and said to the Buddha,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.6_2: and told him what had happened.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.7_0: “Good Gotama has gone forth and so have I.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.8_0: One who has gone forth is worthy of receiving alms from another who has gone forth.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.9_0: Would Master Gotama together with the mendicant Saṅgha please accept tomorrow’s meal from me?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.10_0: And the Buddha consented by remaining silent.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.11_0: The Ājīvaka understood that the Buddha had consented, and he left.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.12_0: who gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.13_0: “Monks, I allow you to eat in a group when the meal is given by an ascetic.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.14_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.15.1_0: ‘If a monk eats in a group, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.16_1: These are the robe-giving season; it is a time of making robes; he is traveling; he is traveling by boat; it is a big occasion; it is a meal given by an ascetic.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.2_0: Wherever four monks have been invited to eat any of the five staple foods.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.6_0: even if he just has cracked feet, he may eat in a group.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.8_0: for one who has not participated in the robe-making procedure, it is the last month of the rainy season. For one who has participated in the robe-making procedure, it is the five-month period.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.8_1: If he has participated in the robe-making procedure, he may eat in a group during the five month period.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.10_0: when he is making robes, he may eat a meal before another.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.12_0: if he intends to travel at least six kilometers, he may eat in a group. And he may eat in a group while he is traveling, and after traveling.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.14_0: if he intends to board a boat, he may eat in a group. And he may eat in a group while on-board, and after disembarking.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.16_0: if two or three monks can get by by walking for alms, but not a group of four,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.16_1: If he eat in a big occasion, he may eat in a group.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.17_0: It is a meal given by an ascetic:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.18_0: if any kind of wanderer is making the meal, he may eat in a group.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.19_0: If he receives it intending to eat it, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.20_0: For every mouthful, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.2.1_0: If it is a group meal, and he perceives it as such, and he eats, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.2.2_0: If it is a group meal, but he is unsure of it, and he eats, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.2.3_0: If it is a group meal, but he does not perceive it as such, and he eats, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.2.4_0: If it is not a group meal, but he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.2.5_0: If it is not a group meal, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.2.6_0: If it is not a group meal, and he does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.3_0: if two or three eat together;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.4_0: if they eat together after walking for alms;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.5_0: if it is a regular meal invitation;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.6_0: if it is a meal for which lots are drawn;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.8_0: if it is on the observance day;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.9_0: if it is on the day after the observance day;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.10_0: if it is anything apart from the five kinds of staple food;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.13_0: The second rule, the training rule on group meals, is finished.
